INTRODUGTION TO THE FOURTH PHILIPPIG.

IN this oration Cicero tells the people what had been done in the senate. 11: seems that he went straight from the Curia to the Forum to make this popular address. In his letter bo D. Brutus (Ad Div. xi. 6), after speaking of the senate being summoned by the Tr. pl. for the xnx Kal. Jan.‚ he says that he was in ‘che Curia in the morning: “Quod quum esset· animadversum, frequentissimi Senatores convenerunt. Quae de te in senaim egerim, quae in contione maxima dixerim, aliorum te literis

malo cognoscere.”
